summary: This bill, the "America’s Olympic and Paralympic Games Commemorative Coins Act," mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue commemorative coins for the 2028 Olympic and Paralympic Games in Los Angeles and the 2034 Winter Olympic and Paralympic Games in Salt Lake City. The bill details coin specifications (gold, silver, and clad), design requirements, issuance periods, sales prices, and surcharges. Surcharges from coin sales will go to the U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Properties (for the 2028 Games) and the Organizing Committee for the 2034 Games, to support the games and their legacy programs.
